intro: Gymnopetalum wightii, commonly known as the Wight's gymnopetalum, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky hillsides. Gymnopetalum wightii is often found in regions with high humidity and well-drained soil.
